reviewText: Between muddy hitboxes, presentation that's barebones even for a budget shmup and a complete lack of content (again, even compared to other budget shmups) I can't really recommend this game unless you just happen to have a couple bucks in your Steam Wallet and are looking for something to do for half an hour or so. The dull bosses that serve as bullet sponges rather than an example of any care in design is the icing on the cake. Video below:\n\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TzoZ5nMiwAw
voteText: 44 of 59 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Being this is a bullet-hell game, having fast-paced gameplay is expected.  However, the games suffered from wrong pacing.  In each stage, the player will go through a few minor enemies, and then fight a boss after only 30 seconds.  After that boss is defeated, a few more minor enemies and another boss will appear again after 30 seconds.  Having bosses so close to each other each, it lessens the pleasure of defeating each one.  If the stages had the bosses spaced a lot further apart, it would have made the action much better.

One thing that could be considered a plus and a minus is the fact that your ship is auto firing the entire time.  Logic says that this is good because you do not have to think about pushing any buttons in order to attack.  However, when you are trying to avoid the enemy bullets, this will cause both shots to blend together making it harder to avoid.  The way that the player controls the firing is by occasionally using one of its special shots.  However, there are times when defense is more important then offense.  Without being able to stop shooting when you want, being able to avoid damage is more difficult than it has to be.

Speaking of which, getting hit seems to have the wrong feeling to it.  If a shot does hit your ship, there will be a slight pause in the action.  Otherwise, things keep moving as if nothing happened.  In other games like Gradius or Raiden, getting hit will have a clear impact on your ship if it does not destroy it.  Seeing no damage does to your ship gives the false sense of security that it is still in good condition.  When you consider that there can be dozens of enemies and bullets on screen at one time, knowing how you are doing through your ship is vital.  The only time you know that is by turning up the difficulty to hard where only one shot is needed to destroy your ship.  Considering the volume of enemies, that could be suicide.

While it is a decent amateur game, it is not one worth recommending.  This game is available at http://blackshellgames.itch.io/ruzhdelta for free.  If you are curious about the game, get it there.  After playing it, if you still it is worth paying for, do it then.

reviewText:
Got a free copy of the game from orlygift.com

Black Shell media is known for small minimum budget indie games that's not very good.

But they are however improving after every creation and getting better and better.

For example this game is very big upgrade from Terablaster".
Being a top down bullet hell shooter it's not bad.

There are however many flaws in the game.. To name a few.. Getting hit pause the screen for 1/4 of a second and it feels really weird. The sound is very very basic and doesn't really fit the game. 30 second of minor enemy between each boss is way too quick and make you feel less satisfy of killing each of the boss.. Having 3+1 stage just feel short and cheap...

Any how .. it's a improved indie bullet hell shooter. There are much better ones out there but this one is quite cheap so you can win from different giveaway for free or just spend 1 dollar to pick a copy for a few minutes of fun...

Being a Touhou Vetern I was able to blast though easy difficulty on first try and i have no doubt that i can do the same with normal and brutal as i learn each of the boss better... I will however stop playing this game because it's just way to simple.

I will not recommend this game for the same reason.. too Simple! I do however encourage developer to keep on trying and one day make a game that's better and have more content.

4/10 would be my final rating.
"

reviewText:
This bullet hell game throws you right into the action. I mean, you get taught about the controls (that feel clunky by the way) and then you start shooting at normal enemies, followed by bosses, followed by normal enemies, followed by bosses, followed by ... well, you get the picture.

The dev didn't even try to add a story to the game.

+ Soundtrack is decent.
+ Good for casual gameplay if you want to waste only a few minutes.
+ The game is cheap.

- No story.
- Mouse control feels clunky at times.
- Little enemy variety.
- Time between boss fights is too short.
- Gets broring fast.

reviewText:
Ruzh Delta Z is a bullet-hell game, where you're shooting at enemies but your screen is full of lasers, bullets and other projectiles thrown at you. It's up to you to avoid a maximum of them, though you'll be hit quite a lot.

True, I've played 11 minutes. But it's enough to try the 3 stages and the 2 ships. Indeed, each of them has special attacks, which takes energy. However, it must be earned, I don't know how though. But each attack will be useful with your screen full of dangers. The first stage, for example, is beginning on a boss, even in the easy difficulty, where you have 200% for your life. After 1 minute, I was already out...

The graphics are reminding me of old games, as the soundtrack. Anyway, it's very bright and colorful, which is nice.

However, Ruzh Delta Z isn't the game you're playing for hours, it's there when you need a break and when you need something different for a few minutes. What I know is that I'll probably never played it again, as bullet-hell games aren't at all my cup of tea. I won this if I remember well and I don't regret it.

Given the fact that it's not my cup of tea, I could put a thumb down. However, the game is well-polished, perhaps short, but well polished and at least, contrary to Exceed, it's in English. If I remain objective, the game deserves a thumb up. For the price, it's good. Would have it been higher, I would have been more negative,

Nah, the game is maybe sober but if you love challenge, Ruzh Delta Z is a good little one.

reviewText:
5min of gameplay
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2MKxTBkHptg

This shmup really knows how to bullet hell.
The game is bare minimum with 3 levels +1 bonus one, about 4 bosses per level, 2 ships & difficulty only effects hp & points.
The ships will auto fire in a spread or you can contain them in a forward shot.
Ships also have 3 special, and 2 will destroy bullet but the alpha ship is better since its bullet killers fire forward.
As you build up points (without getting hit) you'll get lightning bolts that you'll use for your special.
You'll want to save them for the 1 bolt bullet destroyer because you'll clear more bullets than you'll avoid.

reviewText:
Look, I'll give it the benefit of the doubt to say that this game did try. It tries to make a good presentation, however, even though it's flashy and kinda fun to play, it still has its downsides.

Pros:
-Pretty good soundtrack
-Graphics look kind of decent
-Could run on a toaster
-It's an okay time killer

Cons:
-Graphical bits of laziness (walls of color on sprites)
-Mouse control doesn't feel right, very loose
-Very brief and boring
-Gives hell even at normal difficulty
-Presentation overall doesn't feel right

There are much better bullet hell shooters out there - Beat Hazard, Ikaruga, etc...try to get this for free somewhere.
4/10.

reviewText: For $2 I had a blast.  Fun bullet hell with neat mechanics.  You can focus your bullets, but you move slower.  Points get you lightning bolts which you use as currency for your 3 different super weapons.  The cheapest clears a path through incoming bullets, the next shoots a ton of bullets everywhere, and the most expensive is a screen clearer.  3 levels and 3 difficulties, so not very long, but fun.

It's... ok. It's a bullet hell shooter where the fact that you sometimes can't avoid getting hit is mitigated by the fact you have relatively large hp pool and super powers.

While it does serve a purpose of some mild entertainment, the game is really bare bones, from the graphic to the special effects of the bullets flying around.
You can see everything the game has to offer in about 15 minutes of playtime, which is a lot better than Terrablaster, but it's still not that justified for a price of 2â‚¬.

If you really feel the desire to buy every game released on steam, get this one when it goes on sale for less than a euro, I couldn't recommend buying it otherwise.
